essentials

Class Essentials

  • java.lang.Object
    • essentials.Essentials

  • public class Essentials
extends java.lang.Object
    Contains some quite useful methods.
    Author:
    Maximilian von Gaisberg (Grunzwanzling), Felix Beutter
    See Also:
    Javadoc Website

    • Method Detail

      • addComponent

        public static boolean addComponent(java.awt.Container c,
                                   java.awt.GridBagLayout l,
                                   java.awt.Component component,
                                   int x,
                                   int y,
                                   int width,
                                   int height,
                                   double weightx,
                                   double weighty,
                                   java.awt.Insets i)
        Adds a Component to a Container using the GridBagLayout.
        Parameters:
        c - Container to which the Component will be added
        l - Used GridBagLayout object
        component - Component which will be added to the Container
        x - x coordinate of the Component in the grid
        y - y coordinate of the Component in the grid
        width - width of the Component
        height - height of the Component
        weightx - x weight of the Component
        weighty - y weight of the component
        i - Insets which defines the distances around the Component
        Returns:
        boolean false if exception occurred

        m - HashMap<String, Object>
        Returns:
        Object[] which contains HashMap data

      • log

        public static boolean log(java.lang.String text,
                          java.io.File f,
                          boolean printTimestamp)
        Deprecated. SimpleLog handles this much more comfortably and professionally
        Writes a String (with a timestamp) to a File.
        Parameters:
        text - The String, that will be written to the file
        f - The File where the text will be saved to
        printTimestamp - If true, there will be a timestamp in front of the text
        Returns:
        boolean if false, exception occurred

        Writes a String to the end of a File.
        Parameters:
        text - The String, that will be written to the File
        f - The File that should be written to
        Returns:
        boolean false, exception occurred

      • readFile

        public static java.lang.String readFile(java.io.File f)
                                 throws java.io.IOException
        Reads a given File and returns the text
        Parameters:
        f - The File to read
        Returns:
        The content of the file
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if file isn't found or can't be read

      • countFileLines

        public static int countFileLines(java.io.File f)
                          throws java.io.IOException
        Counts the number of lines in the given File. Empty lines will be skipped
        Parameters:
        f - The File to count the lines of
        Returns:
        amount of lines
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if file is not found or can't be read

      • zip

        public static boolean zip(java.io.File zipFile,
                          java.io.File[] containingFiles)
                   throws java.io.IOException
        Put files in an uncompressed .zip archive
        Parameters:
        zipFile - The target zip-archive
        containingFiles - The files to put in the zip-archive
        Returns:
        success
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if files aren't found or can't be written to

      • zipAndCompress

        public static void zipAndCompress(java.lang.String target,
                                  java.lang.String[] files)
                           throws java.io.IOException
        Puts files in a .zip archive and compresses them
        Parameters:
        files - The files to put into the zip-archive
        target - The path of the target zip-archive
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if files aren't found or can't be written to

      • sendHTTPRequest

        public static java.lang.String sendHTTPRequest(java.net.URL l)
                                        throws java.io.IOException
        Send HTTP requests to a webserver and fetch the answer. Will send http.agent=Chrome
        Parameters:
        l - The URL you want to send a request to
        Returns:
        The answer from that URL
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if connection failed

      • sendHTTPRequest

        public static java.lang.String sendHTTPRequest(java.net.URL l,
                                               java.lang.String username,
                                               java.lang.String password)
                                        throws java.io.IOException
        Send a HTTP-Request to a webserver and fetch the answer. Uses basic .htaccess authentication. Will send http.agent=Chrome
        Parameters:
        l - The URL you want to send a request to
        username - The username to send
        password - The password to send
        Returns:
        The answer from that URL
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if connection failed

      • sendHTTPRequest

        public static java.lang.String sendHTTPRequest(java.net.URL l,
                                               java.lang.String cookie)
                                        throws java.io.IOException
        Send HTTP requests to a webserver and fetch the answer including a cookie. Mainly used to login to sites. Will send http.agent=Chrome
        Parameters:
        l - The URL you want to send a request to
        cookie - The cookie represented as a string: "name1=value1; name2=value2; name3=value3"
        Returns:
        The answer from that URL
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if connection failed

      • downloadFileFromURL

        public static boolean downloadFileFromURL(java.net.URL l,
                                          java.io.File saveFile)
                                   throws java.io.IOException,
                                          java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Downloads a File from an URL and saves it to the computer
        Parameters:
        l - The URL of the File
        saveFile - The path where the File should be saved
        Returns:
        success
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if HTTP error code is returned
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - if file has not be found

      • copyBufferedImage

        public static java.awt.image.BufferedImage copyBufferedImage(java.awt.image.BufferedImage i)
        Copies a BufferedImage
        Parameters:
        i - The image that should be copied
        Returns:
        The copied image

      • searchIPs

        public static java.lang.String[] searchIPs(boolean includeLocalhost)
                                    throws java.io.IOException
        Search for all IPs on the local network using the arp -a command. Works only on Windows machines
        Parameters:
        includeLocalhost - If true, the first entry will be 'localhost'
        Returns:
        A String[] containing the IPs
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if command can not be executed

      • getAssembledStringArray

        public static java.lang.String getAssembledStringArray(java.lang.String[] array)
        Assembles a String[] to one String, in which the parts are separated by blanks
        Parameters:
        array - The String array that will be assembled
        Returns:
        The assembled String

      • bytesToHex

        public static java.lang.String bytesToHex(byte[] bs)
        Represents a byte[] in a much more comfortable an readable way
        Parameters:
        bs - the bytes you want to convert
        Returns:
        the hex string

      • escapeURL

        public static java.net.URL escapeURL(java.lang.String s)
        Convert a String to an URL by escaping illegal characters correctly. URLEndocer.encode(); is probably better, but it is somehow deprecated
        Parameters:
        s - The url to escape
        Returns:
        The URL object

      • isIncluded

        public static boolean isIncluded(java.lang.String[] array,
                                 java.lang.String string)
        Checks if a String is included in a String[] *
        Parameters:
        array - String array
        string - String
        Returns:
        true if included, false if not
